TI Dynamic Response Of Maximum Power Point Tracking Using Particle Swarm
   Optimization For Wind Energy Conversion System
SO PROCEEDINGS OF 2016 8TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON INFORMATION
   TECHNOLOGY AND ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING (ICITEE)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 8th International Conference on Information Technology and Electrical
   Engineering (ICITEE)
CY OCT 05-06, 2016
CL Univ Gadjah Mada, Fac Engn, Dept Elect Engn & Informat Technol,
   Yogyakarta, INDONESIA
SP Univ Gadjah Mada Indonesia, KMITL Thailand, IEEE Indonesia Sect
HO Univ Gadjah Mada, Fac Engn, Dept Elect Engn & Informat Technol
DE renewable energy; wind energy; optimization; MPPT; PSO
ID ALGORITHM
AB During this time, the main source of electrical energy derived from fossil energy sources, which is at present the number continues to decrease and become more limited. Therefore, it is necessary to find alternative sources of energy produced by natural processes so it will not run out or quickly reversed if managed properly. In other words, alternative energy sources must be a renewable energy. Some renewable energy sources are now being developed, among others, wind energy, solar energy, geothermal energy, and others. Among the renewable energy sources, in Indonesia, wind energy is the energy source with smallest utilization rate, which only amounted to 3.07 MW or approximately 0.03% potential. This study uses maximum power point tracking (MPPT) algorithm with particle swarm optimization (PSO) to optimize the power output of the wind turbine system at a varying wind speed. The simulation results showed that PSO-based MPPT can increase the efficiency of wind turbine system and give a good response to the wind speed changes.
C1 [Pribadi, Kukuh Daud; Wijaya, F. Danang; Sarjiya] Univ Gadjah Mada, Dept Elect Engn & Informat Technol, Yogyakarta, Indonesia.
RP Pribadi, KD (reprint author), Univ Gadjah Mada, Dept Elect Engn & Informat Technol, Yogyakarta, Indonesia.
EM kukuh.daud.p@mail.ugm.ac.id; danangwijaya@ugm.ac.id; sarjiya@ugm.ac.id

TI Online Faults Diagnosis of Wind Turbine Blades Based on Support Vector
   Machines
SO 2016 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON SYSTEMS AND INFORMATICS (ICSAI)
SE International Conference on Systems and Informatics
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 3rd International Conference on Systems and Informatics (ICSAI)
CY NOV 19-21, 2016
CL Shanghai, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Elect & Informat, Shanghai Dianji Univ, IEEE Syst Man & Cybernet Soc, IEEE Ind Elect Soc, DI
DE online; fault diagnosis; SVM; wind turbine blades
AB In this paper, an online fault diagnosis method of wind turbine blades that is based on SVM (support vector machines) is proposed. First, it uses normalized real-time data of temperature, humidity, brightness and brightness of wind turbine blades to construct feature vectors. Then based on SVM, online fault diagnosis of wind turbine blades can be implemented. Three type of faults which are skin cracking, leading edge cracking, tailing edge cracking are used to verify the method. The results show that it can achieve the expected effect.
C1 [Qiang, Sun] Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Elect Informat Engn, Shanghai, Peoples R China.
   [Lin, Han; Yu, Zhang] Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Elect Engn line, Shanghai, Peoples R China.
RP Qiang, S (reprint author), Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Elect Informat Engn, Shanghai, Peoples R China.

TI An Intelligent Condition-based Monitoring and Maintenance System for
   Wind Turbine
SO 2016 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON SYSTEMS AND INFORMATICS (ICSAI)
SE International Conference on Systems and Informatics
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 3rd International Conference on Systems and Informatics (ICSAI)
CY NOV 19-21, 2016
CL Shanghai, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Elect & Informat, Shanghai Dianji Univ, IEEE Syst Man & Cybernet Soc, IEEE Ind Elect Soc, DI
DE wind turbine; condition monitoring; maintenance; visual platform; human
   interface
AB An architecture based on condition monitoring for wind turbine has been proposed. It made wind turbine change its maintenance manner from reactive maintenance to predictive maintenance and expanded monitoring and maintenance activities into an integrated system with seven function modules in three layers. This system could make up the regional distribution problem, reflect WT real-time working condition, and give a quick warning and maintenance plan before the equipment malfunction. Therefore, it can avoid economic losses and high maintenance costs during stop repairing when trouble occurred, Additionally, it also provided an intelligent interface for humancomputer interaction through multiple networks and all information of wind turbines could be query, processing, analysis, modeling and visual display.
C1 [Fan, Sixia] Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Business, Shanghai, Peoples R China.
   [Zhan, Jian] Res Ctr Shanghai Equip Mfg Ind Dev, Shanghai, Peoples R China.

TI Fault Diagnosis of Gearbox by Selective Ensemble Learning Based on
   Artificial Immune Algorithm
SO 2016 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON SYSTEMS AND INFORMATICS (ICSAI)
SE International Conference on Systems and Informatics
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 3rd International Conference on Systems and Informatics (ICSAI)
CY NOV 19-21, 2016
CL Shanghai, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Elect & Informat, Shanghai Dianji Univ, IEEE Syst Man & Cybernet Soc, IEEE Ind Elect Soc, DI
DE fault diagnosis; artificial immune algorithm; Selective ensemble
   learning algorithm; Support vector machines; Bagging
AB Because faults of gearbox are one of the most important factors of wind turbine, it is very important to research gearbox fault diagnosis technology. The problem of class unbalance is encountered in fault diagnosis of gearbox, which has a serious negative impact on the performance of the classifier of the hypothetical class. While it is critical that previous work rarely pays attention to the problem of gearbox fault diagnosis in this class imbalance. In the problem of imbalance, some features of dataset are superfluous, even irrelevant. These characteristics will affect the generalization performance of the learning machine. Here, it is propose AIEE (based on artificial immune algorithm function selection Easy Ensemble) to improve the gearbox fault diagnosis class imbalance problem. The experimental results of UCI datasets and gearbox fault data sets shows that AIEE algorithm can improve the classification performance and prediction accuracy of unbalanced datasets.
C1 [Liu, Tianyu] Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Elect, Shanghai, Peoples R China.
RP Liu, TY (reprint author), Shanghai Dianji Univ, Sch Elect, Shanghai, Peoples R China.
FU Shanghai Municipal Natural Science Foundation [14ZR1417200,

   Commission [14YZ157, 15ZZ106]

   (No. 14ZR1417200, 15ZR1417300) and Innovation Program of Shanghai
   Municipal Education Commission (No. 14YZ157, 15ZZ106).

TI Shaping Inertial Response from Wind Turbines: A Multi-Objective Approach
SO 2016 IEEE 2ND ANNUAL SOUTHERN POWER ELECTRONICS CONFERENCE (SPEC)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd IEEE Annual Southern Power Electronics Conference (SPEC)
CY DEC 05-08, 2016
CL Auckland, NEW ZEALAND
SP IEEE
DE Inertia; load frequency control; multiobjective optimization; particle
   swarm optimization; variable speed wind turbines
ID PARTICLE SWARM OPTIMIZATION; PRIMARY FREQUENCY CONTROL; KINETIC-ENERGY;
   SUPPORT
AB The present study proposes an alternate approach to design and shape the Emulated Inertial Response (EIR) from Variable Speed Wind Turbines (VSWT) by exchanging its kinetic energy (KE) with the grid. Although, the KE released by the deceleration of VSWT can momentarily reduce the generation-demand difference, and thereby alleviate the frequency stability, limiting the effects of subsequent VSWT recuperation is one of the major challenge of EIR. The selection of the parameters of inertia controller which can balance the see-saw effects of KE exchange is a difficult task due to non-linear nature of the system. Further, the EIR control parameters must be selected judiciously to satisfy multiple and conflicting power system objectives. To address these issues, the present study uses the notion of Pareto-dominance along with Multi-Objective Particle Swarm Optimization (MOPSO) to select EIR control parameters. The efficacy of the proposed approach has been illustrated via simulations considering a case study on a micro-grid. The simulation results demonstrate that the designed EIR could effectively shape the inertial response as per decision makers requirement.
C1 [Hafiz, Faizal; Swain, Akshya Kumar; Patel, Nitish] Univ Auckland, Dept Elect & Comp Engn, Auckland, New Zealand.
   [Kar, A. K.] Unitec Inst Technol, Dept Elect Engn, Auckland, New Zealand.

TI An Improved Dispatchable Wind Turbine Generator and Dual-Battery Energy
   Storage System to Reduce Battery Capacity Requirement
SO 2016 IEEE 2ND ANNUAL SOUTHERN POWER ELECTRONICS CONFERENCE (SPEC)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd IEEE Annual Southern Power Electronics Conference (SPEC)
CY DEC 05-08, 2016
CL Auckland, NEW ZEALAND
SP IEEE
DE Wind energy conversion system; battery energy storage system;
   dispatchability; battery capacity determination
AB This paper examines an improved dual-battery energy storage scheme designed to achieve wind power dispatchability. The capacity of the battery energy storage system is greatly reduced by allowing direct power flow from wind turbine generator to the grid via a dc bus, as the two batteries interchange their charging and discharging roles at specific time. The method to determine the optimal capacity of the energy storage system is given, and is based on the characteristics of the battery and longterm wind power profile. Numerical examples show the validity of the proposed schemes.
C1 [Li, Yang; Choi, S. S.; Vilathgamuwa, D. M.] Queensland Univ Technol, Sch Elect Engn & Comp Sci, Brisbane, Qld, Australia.
   [Yao, D. L.] Nanyang Technol Univ, Sch Elect & Elect Engn, Singapore, Singapore.

TI Electromagnetic Design and Optimization Analysis on an Embedded
   Segmented Rotor Flux Switching Machine
SO 2016 IEEE 2ND ANNUAL SOUTHERN POWER ELECTRONICS CONFERENCE (SPEC)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd IEEE Annual Southern Power Electronics Conference (SPEC)
CY DEC 05-08, 2016
CL Auckland, NEW ZEALAND
SP IEEE
DE optimization; segmented rotor; flux switching machine; field winding
   excitation; permanent magnet excitation
AB With the increase of power offtake requirements, it is proposed that the more electric engine (MEE) draws electrical power from a generator mounted directly on the gas turbine shaft-line without the use of a gearbox. It is expected that this arrangement will improve the power density and reliability of the whole system. The challenges include limited available space, high temperature, affordability, high power density and an exceedingly high reliability requirement. The segmented rotor flux switching machine is one of the promising topologies that are suitable for this application. The objective of this article is to investigate quantitatively the influence of several design parameters on the electromagnetic performance. The design parameters include, the excitation type, stator split ratio, segmented rotor length and load advance angle. Back EMF, cogging torque, average torque, torque ripple and magnetic force are considered to be the key evaluation criteria and are used to guide the search for the optimized design. The material discussed in this paper may be helpful to provide insight in the selection of key design parameters in the direct shaftline gas turbine generators.
C1 [Ma Xiaohe; Wang Shuai] Rolls Royce NTU Corp Lab, 65 Nanyang Dr, Singapore 637460, Singapore.
   [Su Rong; Jet, Tseng King] Nanyang Technol Univ, Sch Elect & Elect Engn, 50 Nanyang Ave, Singapore 639798, Singapore.
   [Vaiyapuri, Viswanathan; Amit, Gupta; RamaKrishna; Chandana, Gajanayake] Rolls Royce Singapore Pte Ltd, Adv Technol Ctr, 6 Seletar Aerosp Rise, Singapore 797575, Singapore.
RP Ma, XH (reprint author), Rolls Royce NTU Corp Lab, 65 Nanyang Dr, Singapore 637460, Singapore.

TI Modulated Model Predictive Rotor Current Control ((MPC)-P-2) of a DFIG
   driven by an Indirect Matrix Converter with Fixed Switching Frequency
SO 2016 IEEE 2ND ANNUAL SOUTHERN POWER ELECTRONICS CONFERENCE (SPEC)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd IEEE Annual Southern Power Electronics Conference (SPEC)
CY DEC 05-08, 2016
CL Auckland, NEW ZEALAND
SP IEEE
ID DIRECT POWER-CONTROL; WIND TURBINES; INDUCTION; GENERATION
AB Conventional finite-set model-based predictive control (FS-MBPC) methods inherently present a variable switching frequency which causes harmonic distortion as well as excessive voltage and current ripple. An indirect power control strategy with fixed frequency capability is presented in this paper for a DFIG driven by an indirect matrix converter. The system initial conditions are maintained for the proposed method, showing improvement in terms of power quality when compared to the conventional FS-MBPC even when a lower sampling frequency is imposed. This strategy is verified to be feasible by successful simulation results, furtherly proving the predictive control capabilities of fast dynamic response and intuitive inclusion of nonlinear constraints into the control algorithm.
C1 [Olloqui, A.; Elizondo, J. L.; Macias, M. E.; Micheloud, O. M.] Tecnol Monterrey, Dept Elect & Computat Engn, Nuevo Leon, Mexico.
   [Rivera, M.] Univ Talca, Dept Ind Technol, Curico, Chile.
   [Pena, R.] Univ Concepcion, Dept Elect Engn, Concepcion, Chile.
   [Wheeler, P.] Univ Nottingham, Dept Elect & Elect Engn, Nottingham, England.

TI Predictive Encoderless Control of Back-to-Back Converter PMSG Wind
   Turbine Systems with Extended Kalman Filter
SO 2016 IEEE 2ND ANNUAL SOUTHERN POWER ELECTRONICS CONFERENCE (SPEC)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd IEEE Annual Southern Power Electronics Conference (SPEC)
CY DEC 05-08, 2016
CL Auckland, NEW ZEALAND
SP IEEE
AB This paper presents a deadbeat-like predictive encoderless control method for back-to-back power converter permanent-magnet synchronous generator (PMSG) wind turbine systems with Extended Kalman Filter (EKF). The generator state variables are estimated through an EKF observer requiring neither the knowledge of mechanical parameters nor the initial position of the rotor. The estimated speed and position are fed into a deadbeat predictive controller using SVM. The grid side control is realized by a deadbeat predictive power controller requiring little tuning efforts. Both the estimator and predictive controllers are implemented on a fully FPGA based platform, using the single-cycle-timed-loop technique, achieving very short calculating time. The effectiveness of the presented method is verified with experimental data.
C1 [Zhang, Zhenbin; Si, Guangye; Kennel, Ralph] Tech Univ Munich, Elect Engn & Informat, D-80333 Munich, Germany.
   [Wang, Fengxiang] Chinese Acad Sci, Quanzhou Inst Equip Mfg, Jinjiang 362200, Quanzhou, Peoples R China.

TI Stability Analysis of a Grid Connected DFIG Based WECS with Two-Mass
   Shaft Modeling
SO 2016 IEEE ANNUAL INDIA CONFERENCE (INDICON)
SE Annual IEEE India Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Annual India Conference (INDICON)
CY DEC 16-18, 2016
CL Bangalore, INDIA
SP IEEE
DE Wind energy conversion system (WECS); doubly-fed induction generator
   (DFIG); two-mass shaft modeling
ID INDUCTION GENERATOR
AB In this paper, the dynamic modeling of a doubly-fed induction generator-based wind turbine connected to infinite bus (SMIB) system, is carried out in detail. In most of the analysis, the DFIG stator transients and network transients are neglected. In this paper the interfacing problems while considering stator transients and network transients in the modeling of SMIB system are resolved by connecting a resistor across the DFIG terminals. The effect of simplification of shaft system on the controller gains is also discussed. In addition, case studies are presented to demonstrate the effect of mechanical parameters and controller gains on system stability when accounting the two-mass shaft model for the drive train system.

TI Fault Estimation and Fault-Tolerant Control of Wind Turbines Using the
   SDW-LSI Algorithm
SO IEEE ACCESS
LA English
DT Article
DE Fault diagnosis; fault tolerant; hydraulic actuators; system
   identification; wind power generation
ID LEAST-SQUARES ALGORITHM; FORGETTING FACTOR; BENCHMARK MODEL; SYSTEMS;
   IDENTIFICATION; DIAGNOSIS; BLADE
AB The dynamic response of the pitch angle slows down when the pitch actuator of wind turbines fails, and the fault leads to fluctuations in the generator speed and in the output power. According to identification and analytical theories, a fault-tolerant control combined with fault estimation is proposed to solve this problem. The simplified two-order transform function of the pitch actuator is transformed into the identification equation by means of the Euler transformation method. Next, the time-varying natural frequency and the damping ratio of pitch actuators are regarded as gradual change and abrupt change parameters; these two parameters are estimated using the proposed sliding data window least squares-based iterative ( SDW-LSI) identification algorithm. The sliding data window length is adjusted when changes in the system parameters are detected. Then, according to analytical theory, a compensation equation is derived in the pitch actuator, and the estimated values are fed back to the compensation module to adjust the relations before and after fault occurrences in the pitch actuator to eliminate the effects caused by the pitch actuator failure. Finally, the feasibility of the SDW-LSI algorithm is validated by choosing the fault of high air content in the hydraulic oil.
C1 [Wu, Dinghui; Liu, Wen; Song, Jin; Shen, Yanxia] Jiangnan Univ, Sch Internet Things Engn, Key Lab Adv Proc Control Light Ind, Minist Educ, Wuxi 214122, Peoples R China.
RP Wu, DH (reprint author), Jiangnan Univ, Sch Internet Things Engn, Key Lab Adv Proc Control Light Ind, Minist Educ, Wuxi 214122, Peoples R China.

TI After-sales maintenance service strategies optimization. An offshore
   wind farm case study
SO IFAC PAPERSONLINE
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 3rd IFAC Workshop on Advanced Maintenance Engineering, Services and
   Technology (AMEST)
CY OCT 19-21, 2016
CL Biarritz, FRANCE
SP Int Federat Automat Control, Tech Comm 5 1 Mfg Plant Control, Int Federat Automat Control, Tech Comm 4 1 Components & Technologies Control, Int Federat Automat Control, Tech Comm 5 2 Mfg Modelling Management & Control, Int Federat Automat Control, Tech Comm 6 4 Fault Detect, Supervis & Safety Tech Proc, Int Federat Automat Control, WG 5 1 Advances Prod Management Syst, European Safety & Reliabil Assoc
DE After-sale services; Asset management; Offshore wind farms; Agent-based
   simulation
ID OF-THE-ART; TURBINES; SYSTEMS
AB After-sale maintenance services for machine manufacturers can be a very profitable source of incomes. Although historically machine manufacturers have mainly been focused on improving their production processes, in the last years many machine manufacturers have also included after-sale service processes into their business strategies. When defining after-sale services, one of the main difficulties is to identify, firstly, which maintenance requirements has each asset, secondly, which maintenance strategy (i.e. corrective-preventive-predictive mix) should be followed in each particular case, and thirdly which resources are needed to schedule and perform the maintenance tasks. With the purpose of supporting this decision making process concerning asset management strategies, in the proposed research it is developed an agent-based simulation tool that allows to identify the correct maintenance strategy. The experiments performed for this particular study allows identifying critical service parameters and resources vs. results (i.e. availability and benefits) trade off optimization for an offshore wind farm case study. (C) 2016, IFAC (International Federation of Automatic Control) Hosting by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
C1 [Sagarna, Irene; Uribetxebarria, Jone; Castellano, Eduardo; Erguido, Asier] IK4 Ikerlan Technol Res Ctr, Operat & Maintenance Area, P JM Arizmendiarrieta 2, Arrasate Mondragon 20500, Spain.

TI Exact Feedback Linearization (EFL) and De-Couple Control of Doubly Fed
   Induction Generator based Wind Turbine
SO PROCEEDINGS OF 14TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON FRONTIERS OF INFORMATION
   TECHNOLOGY PROCEEDINGS - FIT 2016
SE International Conference on Frontiers of Information Technology
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 14th International Conference on Frontiers of Information Technology
   (FIT)
CY DEC 19-21, 2016
CL Islamabad, PAKISTAN
SP IEEE Comp Soc, IEEE, IEEE Comp Soc Tech Comm Scalable Comp & Green Comp, IEEE Ind Elect Soc
DE DFIG; d-q Modeling; Decouple Control; Exact Feedback Linearization;
   Vector Control
AB To trace maximum power points (MPP) daxis and q-axis stator currents are required to be controlled individually, and decoupled for grid voltage support and reactive power injection during the grid faults. A decoupling method for Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG) tied with grid is presented by Exact Feedback Linearization (EFL) based on differential geometry. State feedback linearization conditions are illustrated to check whether the nonlinear system is linearizable or not. State feedback control law which decouples active and reactive powers. The control law is simplified and designed to ensure its realization in practical engineering. The d-q modeling of DFIG is carried out using MATLAB/Simulink in term of synchronous reference frame. The simulations result shows that the proposed control scheme can exactly linearized the DFIG system.
C1 [Azeem, B.; Rehman, F.; Mehmood, C. A.; Ali, S. M.; Khan, B.; Saeed, S.] COMSATS Inst Informat Technol, Dept Elect, Abbottabad, Pakistan.

AU Rehman, F

GP IEEE
TI Control of Grid Interfaced Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG) using
   Adaptive SMC Improved with LVRT Enhancement
SO PROCEEDINGS OF 14TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON FRONTIERS OF INFORMATION
   TECHNOLOGY PROCEEDINGS - FIT 2016
SE International Conference on Frontiers of Information Technology
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 14th International Conference on Frontiers of Information Technology
   (FIT)
CY DEC 19-21, 2016
CL Islamabad, PAKISTAN
SP IEEE Comp Soc, IEEE, IEEE Comp Soc Tech Comm Scalable Comp & Green Comp, IEEE Ind Elect Soc
DE Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG); Sliding mode control (SMC);
   Proportional Integrator (PI); Switch Type fault current limiter (STFCL);
   DC-Chopper; Low Voltage Ride Through (LVRT).
ID WIND TURBINES
AB Doubly-Fed Induction Generator (DFIG) has been used extensively in Variable Speed Constant Frequency (VSCF) technique of wind energy generation systems. For DC-Link voltage regulation we used LM-SMC controller on grid side converter. For LVRT Enhancement hybrid of STFCL and DC-Chopper strategy is used. STFCL has the ability to protect converter from over- current and over-voltage as well as gearbox from over torque. DC-Chopper is an electronic circuitry connected in parallel with DC link capacitor to prevent DC link voltage from increasing. The validity of the proposed approach is further verified by the experimental results on a 1.5MW DFIG prototype and LM-SMC results are analytically compared with conventionally tuned Proportional Integral (PI) control strategy.
C1 [Rehman, Faisal; Azeem, Babar; Mehmood, C. A.; Ali, S. M.; Khan, B.; Rehman, F.] COMSATS Inst Informat Technol, Elect Engn Dept, Abbottabad, Pakistan.
RP Rehman, F (reprint author), COMSATS Inst Informat Technol, Elect Engn Dept, Abbottabad, Pakistan.
EM faisal.rehman.burki@gmail.com; babarazeem@ciit.net.pk;
   chaudhry@ciit.net.pk; engrhallianali@gmail.com; bilalkhan@ciit.net.pk;
   fahadrehman@ciit.net.pk
CR Abad G., 2011, DOUBLY FED INDUCTION, V85

AU Rossi, R

GP IEEE
TI The Effects of Harmonics & Resonance on a Weak Network with DFIG based
   Wind Generation
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
DE Grid System; Weak Network; Wind Farm; Distributed Generation (DG);
   Islanded System; Double Fed Induction Generator (DFIG); Direct on Line
   (DOL); Variable Voltage Variable Frequency (VVVF); Short Circuit Current
   (SCC); Point of Common Coupling (PCC); Power Factor (PF)
AB Large industrial networks connected to weak utility based networks can make use of local generation in order to improve reliability or to make use of excess heat for other purposes (gas turbines, diesel sets etc.). Utilisation of 2nd order damped filters to limit harmonics are common place when large power electronic based drives are used. Given the need to make use of some degree of renewable energy systems is has become necessary to obtain an understanding of how the network stability will be affected when such technologies are considered. The application of a DFIG based wind generation system interconnected to a weak industrial network that makes use of 2nd order damped filters is investigated in order to determine how and if resonance can lake place. The results of such a review have shown that with a changing network (SCC, voltage connection and load) the addition of wind generation can assist in limiting potential resonance impedance issues and offer higher stability to the distribution system. This can be particularly effective with weak networks that experience significant changes to SCC at the point of common coupling with minor network changes as has been the case with this review.
C1 [Rossi, Rene] R Rossi & Associates, Perth, WA, Australia.
RP Rossi, R (reprint author), R Rossi & Associates, Perth, WA, Australia.
CR [Anonymous], ERACS SOFTW

TI System Impact Assessment of Connecting Planned Large-Scale Wind Turbine
   Testing Site to Distribution Power Network in Taiwan
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
DE large-scale wind turbine; system impact; voltage fluctuation; flicker;
   harmonics
AB Taiwan first large-scale wind turbine testing site currently is under planning, designed and constructed. In order to comply with the testing requirements that indicated in technical standards or grid codes, the wind turbine on the site is always needed to connect to the electric power network for interconnection support. However, to avoid the severe affects and cause the power quality problems on the established electric power network, when the wind turbine is connected, it is necessary to perform various system impact analysis and computing on power flows, voltage fluctuation, fault current, and flicker/harmonics etc. during the system planning phase of the wind turbine testing site. For this purpose, the paper is aim to present a study of system impact assessment on the mentioned large-scale wind turbine testing site. The geography location and system structure of the testing site is illustrated first, then the requirements of the grid code are discussed, and a case study that separately connects different types of wind turbines to the established electric power network is used to calculate and simulate the system impacts. Finally, the results are expected to provide significant information to the project of planning the large-scale wind turbine testing site.
C1 [Liu, Yu-Jen; Lin, Cheng-Wei] Natl Chung Cheng Univ, Dept Elect Engn, Chiayi, Taiwan.

TI System Voltage and Frequency Control using DFIG based Wind Energy
   Conversion System
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
ID TURBINES
AB The penetration of wind power in electrical power systems has been increasing at an unprecedented rate. Hence, the wind generators can be expected to behave more like the conventional generators. A doubly fed induction generator (DFIG) has two converters connected to the rotor winding which can be useful in supplying additional active and reactive power to the system during system frequency and voltage sag respectively. This paper proposes to use two separate current control loops on the Machine Side Converter to supply additional active power during system frequency distortions and to reduce the transients in stator voltage after clearing the system voltage dips. In so far we have proposed the design of a current controller on the Grid Side Converter (GSC) to bring the system voltage level to the desired level during the system voltage sag condition. The result and concepts has been validated using MATLAB/SIMULINK environment.

GP IEEE
TI Dynamic Equivalence of Wind Farm Considering Operational Condition of
   Wind Turbines
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
DE dynamic equivalence; wind farm; operation condition; SCADA data; dynamic
   gray relevance
AB Focusing on dynamic equivalence of wind farm, a novel method considering operational condition of wind turbines is proposed in this paper. A correlation matrix G is formed by the dynamic gray relational analysis to reflect the dynamic gray relevance among the operational conditions of wind turbines. Then the dynamic equivalent model of wind farm is built after dividing the sample groups of G into several clusters as the wind turbine groups and calculating the equivalent parameters of each group. Finally, simulation for an actual wind farm is performed on the advanced digital power system simulator(ADPSS). The results show that the proposed model can accurately reflect the dynamic response characteristics of wind farm with the accuracy similar to the detailed model. Meanwhile, the proposed model is simplified and can reduce computation complexity.
C1 [Fang, Ruiming; Wu, Mingling] Huaqiao Univ, Dept Elect Engn, Xiamen, Peoples R China.

TI Identification and Analysis of Subsynchronous Oscillations in DFIG Based
   Wind Power Plants
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
ID SERIES-COMPENSATED NETWORK; SUB-SYNCHRONOUS RESONANCE; SSR ANALYSIS;
   GENERATOR; FARMS; MODEL
AB The increasing penetration of wind power into grid systems made it necessary for the integration of wind farms with series compensated transmission networks to ensure reliable and efficient power flow. In this paper the phenomenon of Sub Synchronous Resonance (SSR) observed in series capacitor compensated Doubly-Fed Induction Generator (DFIG) based wind energy systems has been investigated. The study system based on IEEE First Bench Mark (FBM) model for SSR studies with integrated DFIG wind turbine to grid through series compensated transmission network is simulated in MATLAB and the eigen value analysis is carried out. The various modes of oscillations such as subsynchronous resonance (SSR), supersynchronous resonance (SupSR), electromechanical, shaft and system modes are identified and analysed.
C1 [Jayakrishnan, S. R.; Lekshmi, Dhanuja J.; Cheriyan, Elizabeth P.; Sindhu, T. K.] Natl Inst Technol, Elect Engn Dept, Calicut 673601, Kerala, India.

TI Torsional Oscillation Damping Control for Wind Turbine Generator under
   Strong Wind Conditions
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
AB This paper proposed the control system that torsional oscillation damping control for wind turbine generator under strong wind conditions. It is assumed that wind turbine is permanent magnet synchronous generators and consisted of two mass system, which is wind turbine and generator. The blades and generator are connected to the shaft and due to the different inertia of blades and generator, a torsion occurs in the shalt In general, torsions are reduced over time because of wind turbine mechanical losses. However, shaft systems have resonance frequency that amplify torsions, and did not damp the oscillation. As a result, the shaft may be damaged or broken. The proposed method is damping the response at resonant frequency by using H-infinity controller and considering rotating speeds controlling method.
C1 [Kina, Atsushi; Ludin, Gul Ahmad; Senjyu, Tomonobu] Univ Ryukyus, Fac Elect, Nishihara, Okinawa 9030213, Japan.
   [Howlader, Abdul Motin] Univ Hawaii, Hawaii Nat Energy Inst, 1680 East West Rd,Post 109, Honolulu, HI 96822 USA.

TI Optimal Design Combined with Power Management for Stand-Alone Microgrid
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
DE DC microgrid; optimal sizing method; power management
AB This paper proposes a new optimal sizing method combining conventional optimal sizing method and management power to applies for standalone DC microgrid system. This system focuses on the combination of wind turbine (WT), photovoltaic (PV) as the main sources of energy and storage batteries. In addition, it uses diesel engine as an additional source of rescue and dump load to dissipate the overproduction. The load presented by consumption of an office in Ho Chi Minh City with the 12kW peak load. At first, the paper presents the conventional optimal sizing method. After that, it consider power management strategy and apply to new method. The advantages of new method are enhance accuracy, battery and wind turbine life prolongation as well as the decrease of fossil energy. Based on the availability index and levelized cost of energy (LCOE) value, the number of PV and WT will be chosen. The new algorithm result will be verified by HOMER software.
C1 [Dung Phan Quoc; Viet Nguyen Chan; Tuyen Nguyen Dinh; Tien Nguyen The] HCM City Univ Technol, HCMUT VNU, Fac Elect & Elect Engn, Hcm City, Vietnam.
   [Hiep Le Chi] HCM City Int Univ, HCMUT VNU, Dept Mech Engn, Hcm City, Vietnam.

TI Multi-AOA Optimization of Variable-Speed Wind Turbine Airfoils
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
DE variable speed wind turbine; airfoil design; multiple angle of attack
ID REDUCTION
AB Considering that the operating angle of attack (AOA) of a blade element on a variable-speed wind turbine (VSWT) cannot be maintained at a single value due to the slow dynamic behavior of the turbine, the multi-AOA based airfoil design is gradually becoming a significant approach to improve the efficiency of energy capture for the blade element. However, a key issue of this method, the selection of multiple design AOAs and weight factors in the objective function, still relies on engineering experience at present, due to lack of investigation on the distribution of operating AOAs. Therefore, the operating AOA distribution of VSWTs' blade element is firstly investigated and described based on the inflow wind energy in this paper. Furthermore, by focusing on increasing the lift-to-drag ratios at the AOAs with the concentrated distribution of inflow wind energy, a multi-AOA design optimization method for VAWT airfoil is proposed. Finally, the proposed method is applied to optimize the airfoil NACA64618 and verified by simulation results.
C1 [Yang Zhiqiang; Yin Minghui; Chen Xiaoyang; Chen Zaiyu; Zou Yun] Nanjing Univ Sci & Technol, Sch Automat, Nanjing, Jiangsu, Peoples R China.
RP Yin, MH (reprint author), Nanjing Univ Sci & Technol, Sch Automat, Nanjing, Jiangsu, Peoples R China.
EM ymhui@vip.163.com

GP IEEE
TI Islanding Operation of Small Vertical Axis Wind Turbine Under a Wide
   Wind Speed Area
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
AB Recently, from the viewpoint of environmental problems, wind turbines and photovoltaic generators are gaining a lot of attention. Also, household connected small wind turbines have been introduced. Therefore in this paper, operation method for small vertical axis wind turbine is proposed. The conventional control system of wind turbine stops generation when the wind speed exceeds 25 m/s. However, the proposed generator is rotated at a low speed, and it continues generation when the wind speed is more than 25 m/s. The output power of the wind turbine is rectified by diode bridge, and the power coefficient is controlled by a buck converter. The advantages of the wind turbine are simple control system and effectively utilization of wind energy.

PT J
AU Swain, S
   Ray, PK
AF Swain, Snehaprava
   Ray, Pravat Kumar
GP IEEE
TI Fault Ridethrough and Power Quality Improvement of Doubly-Fed Induction
   Generator based Wind Turbine System during Grid Fault with Novel Active
   Crowbar Protection Design
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2016 IEEE REGION 10 CONFERENCE (TENCON)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Region 10 Conference (TENCON)
CY NOV 22-25, 2016
CL SINGAPORE
SP IEEE, MEDs Technologies, CST, Infineon, Rolls Royce, Plexim, Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Springer
DE Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG); Fault-ride Through (FRT); Novel
   Active Crowbar Protection (NACB_P); Wind Energy Conversion System
   (WECS); Wind Turbine (WT)
ID DFIG
AB In this paper a Novel Active Crowbar Protection (NACB_P) system is proposed to enhance the Fault-ride through (FRT) capability of Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG) to enrich the power quality of the overall system. The proposed protection scheme is designed with a capacitor in series with the resistor unlike conventional Crowbar (CB) having only resistors. NACB_P plays an important role in maintaining the connection of DFIG with the grid during fault to provide continuous power supply to the loads. The capacitor accommodates all the ripples generated in the rotor current and protects the converter as well as the DC-link capacitor. The main objectives of the proposed approach are: minimization of rotor fault currents, maintaining constant dc-link voltage across the converter, reduction in the operation time of the crowbar to avoid disconnection between the DFIG and the Rotor side converter (RSC), improvement in the transient response of terminal voltage, and overall improvement in the dynamic response of the MG. These objectives are solved by injecting NACB_P design scheme between the rotor of the DFIG and RSC for a very small duration of time during grid disturbances. To validate the proposed scheme, different fault conditions are considered and it is observed that there is significant improvement in the objectives of this work. Simulation results are carried out on 1.7 VIVA, MG based Wind Energy Conversion System (WECS) using MATLAB/Simulation and are compared without and with the triggering of the proposed scheme.
C1 [Swain, Snehaprava] NIT Rourkela, Dept Elect Engn, Rourkela, Odisha, India.
   [Ray, Pravat Kumar] Nanyang Technol Univ, Sch Elect Engn, Singapore, Singapore.
RP Swain, S (reprint author), NIT Rourkela, Dept Elect Engn, Rourkela, Odisha, India.

TI Big Data-based Harmonic Problem Research in Wind Farms
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON WIRELESS
   COMMUNICATION AND SENSOR NETWORKS (WCSN 2016)
SE ACSR-Advances in Comptuer Science Research
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 3rd International Conference on Wireless Communication and Sensor
   Networks (WCSN)
CY DEC 10-11, 2016
CL Wuhan, PEOPLES R CHINA
DE Big Data; Wind Farms; Harmonics; Data Mining; Clustering
AB More and more attention on the power quality of wind farms has been paid recent years, in which harmonic problem is one of the most concerned. On the other hand, power big data in wind farm generated all the time, and the volume is increasing continuously, which can be mined to extract some special or new information to solve current operating problem and adjust the running conditions of wind turbines. In this paper, a novel algorithm for power big data analysis has been put forward by a combined application of conventional harmonic analyzing method and typical clustering algorithm, which can be used to deal with the big data in wind farm to study harmonic problem. The measured big data of a 2MW DFIG wind turbine in operation have been used to verify the new algorithm, and some interesting conclusions of harmonics have been found at last.

PT J
AU Aggarwal, M
   Singh, M
   Gupta, SK
AF Aggarwal, Manju
   Singh, Madhusudan
   Gupta, S. K.
GP IEEE
TI Performance Enhancement of Wind Farm with Distribution Static
   Compensator
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Squirrel Cage Induction Generator (SCIG); Wind Farm; DSTATCOM; Grid
   Code; FRT
ID RENEWABLE-ENERGY-SOURCES; POWER; SYSTEMS; INTEGRATION; GENERATION
AB In this paper, dynamic performance of wind farm comprising of three Squirrel Cage Induction Generators (SCIG) is analyzed for grid connected operation. Wind integration causes power imbalances and power system dynamics leading to system instability. The SCIG based wind turbine requires reactive power for magnetization which causes shortage of reactive power in distribution system and hence causes losses that lead to instability of power system. The behavior of the system is analyzed with variation in wind speed, unbalanced and nonlinear loads and three phase fault. The DSTATCOM is being used to improve the performance of wind farm as per the standard of grid code. The grid code demands that power plant of any kind should support electricity network throughout their operation. The performance enhancement mainly involves the power quality issues and grid stability and fault ride through (FRT) capability. A complete power balance analysis of the proposed system is presented under different operating conditions.
C1 [Aggarwal, Manju; Gupta, S. K.] DCRUST, Elect Engn Dept, Murthal, Haryana, India.

AU Bansal, D
   Pandey, K
AF Bansal, Deeksha
   Pandey, Kamlesh
GP IEEE
TI Blade Pitch Angle and Tip Speed Ratio Control Schemes for Constant Power
   Generation of WECS
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Wind speed; control schemes; Blade pitch angle; Tip speed ratio;
   Renewable energy
AB The mechanical control schemes based on blade pitch angle and the other scheme tip speed ratio in Wind Turbine (WT) operation are required to attain constant power generation. Therefore, it is required to use peculiar and effective controllers to implement and investigate in such a way to attain torque which should be constant. The suitable and effective controlling methodologies are proportional-integral (PI)/artificial neural network (ANN) based blade pitch angle and tip speed ratio controllers are designed and considered for performance investigation related to and have effect on torque stability and response time. The proposed system is designed in such an environment which gives better result i.e. MATLAB/Simulink environment and investigated under variable conditions of wind speed. However, the performance of the system is found satisfactory with the PT/ANN based controllers.

TI Meticulous Analysis and Optimization of Maximum Power Point Tracking
   Techniques for Standalone Wind Energy Conversion System
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper

CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Wind Turbine; PMSG; MPPT; Fuzzy Logic
ID TURBINE
AB This Paper proposed fuzzy logic based maximum power point tracking technique (MPPT) for wind energy conversion system. There are number of tracking techniques but it all have some disadvantages like in some of the technique required to measure wind speed which is difficult to accurate measurement. The propose fuzzy controller tracks the maximum power point (MPP) by measuring the voltage and current. In fuzzy based maximum power point tracking technique main aim of the fuzzy controller is to adjust the duty cycle of DC-DC Boost converter to achieve maximum power point. The fuzzy logic performance evaluated through simulation. From the simulation results it can be easily observed how much power will increased by using fuzzy based maximum power point tracking technique.

GP IEEE
TI Design, Simulation and Sensitivity Analysis of an Off-grid Hybrid System
   based on Renewable Energies for a Rural Area in Iran
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Hybrid System; Renewable Energy; Sensitivity Analysis; Homer
ID STAND-ALONE; TECHNOECONOMIC ANALYSIS; POWER-SYSTEMS; FEASIBILITY;
   TECHNOLOGIES
AB In this paper, based on the potentials of wind and solar energy resources, a hybrid system is proposed and simulated to supply the electrical energy consumption of Bakandi rural area in Iran. Three scenarios are selected and analyzed among those proposed by simulation results and it is realized that for a specified fuel price and average wind speed, the hybrid system consisting of wind turbines, diesel generators, batteries, and a converter is the most suitable scenario. In addition, sensitivity analysis is performed and analyzed in order to evaluate the effect of probable uncertainties including changes in the average wind speed and fuel price. The results of sensitivity analysis reveal some changes in configuration of the proposed system in case of fuel price or average wind speed variations.
C1 [Ghorbanzadeh, Mehrnaz; Shahhoseini, Ali] Qazvin Islamic Azad Univ, Elect Engn Dept, Qazvin, Iran.

TI Short Circuit Current Comparison of DFIG during Symmetrical Faults with
   Different Wind Speeds
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper

   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG); Protection; Short Circuit
   Current; Wind Power Generation
AB The short-circuit current calculation of any equipment in the power system is very important for selection of appropriate relay characteristics and circuit breaker for the protection of the system. The power system is undergoing changes because of large scale penetration of renewable energy sources in the conventional system. Major renewable sources which are included in the power system are wind energy and solar energy sources. The wind energy is supplied by wind turbine generators of various types. Type III generators i.e. Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG) is the most common types of generator employed offering different behavior compared to conventionally employed synchronous generators. In this paper; the short circuit current contribution of DFIG is calculated analytically and the same is validated by PSCAD/EMTDC software under various wind speeds and by considering certain voltage drops of the generator output.
C1 [Gohil, Hardik B.; Mehta, Chintan R.; Vora, Santosh C.] Nirma Univ, Inst Technol, Dept Elect Engn, Ahmadabad, Gujarat, India.

TI Intelligent Control of Hybrid Power Systems for Load Balancing and
   Levelised Cost
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER

LA English
DT Proceedings Paper

DE Hybrid PV/Wind System; Fuzzy Inference; Boost Converter; Levelised Cost;
   Energy Management; Battery Storage
ID CONVERTER
AB This paper provides an intelligent regulatory for wind-PV hybrid system. The regulatory methods is implemented to obtain maximum available energy during the deviating constraints such as irradiance and wind speed along with power quality maintenance. Levelised cost of electricity is being practiced in major parts of the system for better operation. In additional an efficient energy management system was employed in a standalone system for even power distribution throughout a day. The usage of Intelligent supervisory for switching of boost converter is most important in obtaining output of PV system. Integration of the system with grid by utilising DC-AC converter (Inverter) for energy transfer from the PV array and wind turbine to grid with constant common de voltage. The simulation results depicts that the entire regulatory system has been deployed utilizing power system transient analysis tool in MATLAB Simulink. Results also depict the controlled performance and dynamic behaviour of the hybrid system.

TI Fuzzy Inference Model Synthesis of a Novel Magnetically Levitated VAWT
   with MPPT via Guide Flaps
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Fuzzy Inference Model; Non-linear Parameters; Power Curve; VAWT-GV; Wind
   Energy Conversion System
AB This paper presents a Fuzzy inference system (FIS) for levitated Vertical Axis Wind Turbine (VAWT) with Omni-directional guide vanes; which act as wind concentrator as well as wind shield. The non-linearities of Wind Energy Conversion System (WECS) are successfully mapped using fuzzy logic. Features of the proposed WECS include three concave rotating wind vanes situated at the external periphery of the turbine and a hybrid design of VAWT resulting in optimum tip speed ratio (TSR). Venturi effect is produced by dynamically altering the angles of the flaps by closed loop mechanism. The vanes shield the turbine from high velocity winds & augment its performance in low velocity winds. The proposed FIS approach is to approximate the power curve by using an adaptive neural fuzzy inference system based on Sugeno model that uses the wind speed and Guide Vane's angle as the inputs and the mechanical power as the output. A hardware prototype of the WECS is used for collecting training data for different guide vane's angle and wind speed conditions. The experimental data obtained is used to train FIS and optimization method used is hybrid method. Thus; WECS with its non-linear parameters is successfully modeled.
C1 [Gupta, Nitin; Kumar, Aashish; Banerjee, Sandeep] BVCOE, EEED, Delhi, India.
   [Joshi, Dheeraj] DTU, EED, Delhi, India.
RP Gupta, N (reprint author), BVCOE, EEED, Delhi, India.

TI Magnetically Levitated VAWT with Closed Loop Wind Speed Conditioning
   Guide Vanes
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Guide Vanes; Magnetic Leviation; VAWT; Venturi Effect
AB This paper presents a novel magnetically levitated Vertical Axis Wind Turbine (VAWT) with Omnidirectional guide vanes which act as wind concentrator as well as wind shield. Three rotating wind guide vanes/flaps of concave shape are placed on the outer periphery of the turbine. Venturi effect is produced by dynamically changing the angles of the flaps by closed loop control. The vanes protect the turbine from high velocity winds & increase its performance under low velocity winds. There are two modes of guide vanes operation. In the first mode, all the vanes are synchronized and angle of guide vanes is same for all. In the second mode, an additional sensor reads direction of wind and accordingly the system aligns guide vanes individually. A microcontroller based hardware prototype of the turbine has been fabricated and tested for different conditions. The magnetic suspension results in reduced frictional losses. The results obtained validate the advantages of the fabricated turbine as compared to other configurations.
C1 [Gupta, Nitin; Kumar, Aashish; Banerjee, Sandeep] BVCOE, EEED, Delhi, India.
   [Jha, Sumir] MSIT, ECED, Delhi, India.

DE Doubly Fed Induction Generator; Wind Energy Conversion System; Wind
   Turbine; Grid Side Converter; Rotor Side Converter
AB In this paper the analysis of Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFIG) based Wind Energy Conversion System (WECS) is carried out and simultaneously the behavior of DFIG based WECS under normal and abnormal condition is discussed. At rotor side during abnormal condition it is observed that the dc link voltage and rotor speed of DFIG wind turbine increases, whereas the terminal voltage and the active power of the DFIG based WECS is decreased and the stator flux is freezes to zero during symmetrical fault. An extensive digital simulation of 1.5 MW, 50 Hz wind energy conversion system is carried out using MATLAB/SIMULINK software.

HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Automatic Generation Control (AGC); Load Frequency Control (LFC);
   Electrical Vehicle (EV); PID; Fractional Order PID (FPID)
AB Load Frequency Control (LFC) by Automatic Generation Control (AGC) is implemented in a mixed power system all over the world. It is natural to find multiple units in an area which is further interconnected to another area having different or same types of generating units. This paper presents the performance analysis of AGC for thermal, hydro, wind and nuclear turbine based power system. This paper discuss how the interconnected two area power system is regulated by optimum tuning of fractional order PID (FPID) controller along with the Electrical Vehicle (EV) loading. Control performance and dynamic frequency response analysis of multi-unit two area interconnected systems is simulated and intensively studied by Matlab/Simulink environment. The tie-line power response and frequency deviation of both areas are analyzed by FPID separately and comparatively with or without EV load. It is observed by subjecting the system under 10% load perturbation along with EV load that improved the dynamic response of AGC significantly.

TI Performance Analysis of Wind Turbines with Different Ratings for Site
   Matching
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Wind Turbines; Wind Energy Conversion Systems (WECS); Capacity Factor;
   Availability Factor
ID CAPACITY FACTOR; GENERATORS
AB The energy extracting efficiency of a wind energy conversion system (WECS) depends on the suitability between wind turbine and wind energy conversion site. Capacity factor is a parameter widely used for matching wind turbines with a windy site with its high value desired. A high capacity factor ensures low cost of wind energy conversion system. In addition to this availability factor is another parameter of performance index of a wind turbine. A High value of availability factor indicates that wind turbine is operational most of the time. Availability factor is important because the decision of licensing agencies may depend on it in order to support the operational planning of the utility in the area. For a wind energy site these factors depends on speed ratings of the wind turbine i.e. cut-in speed, rated speed and cut-out speed. But these parameters have different effects on capacity factor and availability factor under different conditions. In this paper an attempt has been made to analyze such effect using fifteen wind turbines. Simulation results using MATLAB coding are found to be effective to propose few recommendations for the selection of wind turbines for variable wind speed zones.
C1 [Kala, Himani] NIT Kurukshetra, Sch Renewable Energy & Efficiency, Kurukshetra, Haryana, India.
   [Sandhu, K. S.] NIT Kurukshetra, Dept Elect Engn, Kurukshetra, Haryana, India.

TI Optimization of Cost and Emission in a Renewable Energy Micro-Grid
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Mixed Integer Programming; Micro-grid; Minimize Cost; Emission
AB The conventional sources and central generation systems are becoming outdated. Moreover, they don't seem to be capable of fulfilling the growing energy demand in future and are major cause of pollution and Green House effect. In recent years, Renewable Energy and Distributed Generation systems have become a hot topic and alot of research is carried out in these fields. In this paper, a renewable energy micro-grid containing PV and wind energy sources with Micro-Turbine, Fuel cell, Battery and Grid as backup sources is studied. The total operational cost and emissions of the micro-grid(MG) are minimized to obtain the optimal power schedule of a day. For this purpose, a mixed integer non-linear programming (MINLP) method is used and results are compared with other programming algorithms like Particle Swarm optimization (PSO) and Genetic algorithm (GA).

GP IEEE
TI Enhancing Fault Ride Capability in DFIG based Wind Farm using
   Supplementary Rotor Controller and Dynamic Voltage Restorer
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Doubly Fed Induction Generator (DFlG); Fault Ride through; Dynamic
   Voltage Restorer
ID TURBINES
AB Fault ride capability in doubly fed induction generators (DFIG) poses three main objectives; (i) the gradual rise of voltage after the fault is cleared in compliance with the grid codes,(ii) limiting rotor inrush current and (III) limiting DC link overvoltage. This paper proposes a new scheme using dynamic voltage restorer (DVR) and supplementary rotor controller (SRC) to enhance the fault ride through process. DVR which is connected on the stator side and the supplementary rotor controller comes into action only during the fault period. The simulation analysis done in PSCAD/EMTDC shows that the proposed scheme can successfully achieve the fault ride through objectives.
C1 [Kesharwani, Sourabh; Lekshmi, Dhanuja; Kumar, T. K. Sunil] Natl Inst Technol, Dept Elect Engn, Calicut 673601, Kozhikode, India.

PT J
AU Mishra, S
   Ansari, MA
   Kumar, N
AF Mishra, Shivani
   Ansari, M. A.

GP IEEE
TI Enrichment of Electricity Access by Renewable Sources through Isolated
   Mini-Grid for Remote Locations
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Mini-Grid; Remote Location Electrification; PV Cell; Wind Turbine;
   Battery; MATLAB Simulation
AB Conventional grid extension has been the leading mode of electrification in India. A number of remotely located villages in India are yet to be electrified by developing renewable energy based mini grids at remote locations to meet the energy demand. By which, we can utilize renewable sources of energy. The mini grids are profitable in remote areas to provide sustainable, reliable and cost effective electricity. This paper identifies the potential applications of mini-grid (MG) in rural electrification. In this proposed model of mini-grid, simulation is used through which solar PV and wind turbines are used to electrify the rural areas. Solar PV is used to generate electricity only in day time so for the continuation of supply to the rural areas, wind turbine is used to generate electricity in night also. Battery has been used for backup for additional requirement of power in the mini-grid system. The proposed model gives the significant reduction in voltage and current harmonics due to the application of diode (neutral) point clamped 11-level inverter by which reliable electricity is produced.
C1 [Mishra, Shivani; Ansari, M. A.; Kumar, Narendra] Gautam Buddha Univ, Elect Engn Dept, Greater Noida, India.
   Delhi Tech Univ, Elect Engn Dept, Delhi, India.

PT J
AU Pali, BS
   Vadhera, S
AF Pali, Bahadur Singh
   Vadhera, Shelly
GP IEEE
TI Renewable Energy Systems for Generating Electric Power: A Review
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE renewable energy source; hybrid generation; wind energy system; solar
   energy; constant voltage; constant frequency
ID EXCITED INDUCTION GENERATOR; STEADY-STATE ANALYSIS; VARIABLE-SPEED;
   PERFORMANCE EVALUATION; BATTERY STORAGE; DOUBLE-OUTPUT; WIND TURBINE;
   CONVERSION SYSTEM; LOAD CONTROLLER; COST-ANALYSIS
AB This paper reviews various schemes utilized for generating electric power from renewable energy resources, which are suitable for interconnecting with a power grid as well as for using as an isolated system. As all the renewable energy resources except geothermal energy, being climate dependent, the power generated from them is of varying magnitude even sometimes no power is generated at all. The other drawbacks are the poor power quality and the high cost of generation, which are the big challenges for meeting the target of ever increasing demand of electric power by renewable energy systems in an efficient and effective way. The various schemes described in the literature for improving the power quality as well as the overall performance of the system by using developed technologies involving power electronics, are reviewed in the paper. In order to achieve the continuous power of constant magnitude up to the satisfactory level, the hybrid schemes using two or more renewable energy sources or any conventional system with some energy storage methods for backup are also discussed. Despite this technological development, still an urgent need to further investigate some other renewable energy source or scheme to provide continuous energy of constant magnitude at low cost is earnestly observed in the paper.
C1 [Pali, Bahadur Singh] Natl Inst Technol, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE, Kurukshetra, Haryana, India.

AU Preeti
   Sharma, V

AF Preeti
   Sharma, Veena

GP IEEE
TI Automatic Generation Control of Multi-source Interconnected Power System
   Including DFIG Wind Turbine
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Frequency Control; Wind Turbine; Inertia Control; Pitch Control;
   Gravitational Search Algorithm; Opposition Based Learning
ID GRAVITATIONAL SEARCH ALGORITHM; FED INDUCTION GENERATOR
AB This paper presents the solution of automatic generation control (AGC) problem of four-area interconnected power system including DFIG (doubly fed induction generator) wind turbine using gravitational search algorithm (GSA). The GSA is used to tune the gains of the speed as well as pitch angle controller of the DFIG wind turbine along with the proportional integrated derivative (PID) controlled interconnected system. To accelerate the performance of the basic GSA, the opposition based learning concept is embedded in GSA and is known as opposition learning based GSA (OGSA). The simulation results show the effectiveness of the OGSA optimized controllers in comparison to GSA in terms of faster convergence, settling time, overshoot and undershoot of the deviations in frequency and tie-line power. The variation of the wind penetration in the considered power system from 10% to 40% is used to show the competency of the proposed controller. The performance of the proposed controller is also shown for the large load perturbation in the control areas from 0.1 p.u MW to 0.4 p.u MW.
C1 [Preeti; Sharma, Veena; Naresh, R.; Pulluri, Harish] Natl Inst Technol, Elect Engn Dept, Hamirpur, Himachal Prades, India.
RP Preeti (reprint author), Natl Inst Technol, Elect Engn Dept, Hamirpur, Himachal Prades, India.

AF Priyanka, Ch.

GP IEEE
TI Modelling of Wind Farm Layout based on Analytical Distance Variant
   Method
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Wind Farm; Optimal Layout; Prevailing Wind Direction; Wake-Effect; GA;
   PSO
ID GENETIC ALGORITHMS; OPTIMAL PLACEMENT; TURBINES; OPTIMIZATION
AB A tremendous potential has been shown by wind energy for the power generation in recent decade. The wind turbines with electrical machines placed in the wind farm generates bulk power. The efficient layout of the wind farm plays an important role for extracting maximum energy from these wind farms and this layout decides the location of each turbine in the wind farm. This paper proposes a simple analytical method using design variable as distance between any two turbines for a given wind farm. Unlike non-linear optimization methods like Genetic Algorithm(GA) and Particle Swarm Optimization(PSO) algorithm, the proposed method involves simple calculations subjected to varying distances among wind turbines. Layout of wind farms is analyzed with fixed wind speed-prevailing single wind direction for the proposed method and the results have been compared with the traditional methods, GA and PSO.
C1 [Priyanka, Ch.; VijayaPriya, R.; Raja, P.] Natl Inst Technol, IEEE, Dept Elect & Elect Engn, Tiruchchirappalli, Tamil Nadu, India.
RP Raja, P (reprint author), Natl Inst Technol, IEEE, Dept Elect & Elect Engn, Tiruchchirappalli, Tamil Nadu, India.

TI Study of Output Parameters of Horizontal Axis Wind Turbines using
   Experimental Test Setup
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Component; Wind Turbine; Wind Turbine Blades; Output Voltage; Blade
   Parameters
AB Energy has turned to be one of the most basic needs of the humans. Wind energy has been a major source of enerey for the society for the past thousand years. Wind enerey is a clean and pollution free enerey source which can be relied up on for the lone-term future. A wind turbine creates cost-effective, pollution free, reliable sources of enerey. A sinele wind turbine is sufficient for the generation of energy which is required by a household. Wind turbines generates power without the usage of fossil fuels, neither have they produced greenhouse eases nor they generate radioactive or toxic waste. There is always a significant need for better sources of enerey that is lone term reliable. The dependence on conventional sources of enerey must be reduced, better and renewable sources of enerey must be investigated and should be brought into use. There are various factors affecting the energy generation using wind turbines such as wind parameters which are natural and the turbine parameters. The wind turbine design and its dimensions are one of the major factors affecting the output voltage generated by the wind turbines. The wind turbine blades design includes the pitch angle, the blade length, the width of the blade, weight and the aerodynamic modeling of the blades. Therefore it is necessary to study the effect of all these parameters on the output voltage generated by the conventional type of horizontal axis wind turbines. The paper describes the study of various parameters affecting the working of wind turbines and their effect on the output voltage.

TI Laboratory Set Up for the Study of the Effect of Vertical Shear on
   Horizontal Axis Wind Turbine
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER

LA English
DT Proceedings Paper

CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Component; Wind Turbine; Vertical Wind Shear; Flicker Voltage
AB In today's world due to fast and rapid depletion of the conventional and nonrenewable energy resources it calls upon the requirement for sources of alternative energy, clean, green, and renewability are the top priorities. Using wind power to produce electricity is a perfect fit. Because wind energy has become the least expensive source of new electric power that is also compatible with environment preservation programs many countries promote wind power technology by means of national programs and market incentives. Also it provides an effective solution for reduction of fossil fuel consumption and pollutant emissions. The wind turbines are used for the generation of wind energy, simple in construction, economical and which gives appreciable output. Wind shear is one of the major factors affecting the working of wind turbines. Vertical shear, or the change of winds with height, either enhances or diminishes the vertical draft strengths. Input parameters and output parameters vary with different turbines. Flicker voltage is one of the major parameter concerned with the wind turbine parameters. Voltage flicker are caused due to heavy loads periodically turned on and off in a weak distribution system. This paper presents the effect produced in the output voltage and flicker voltage due to vertical wind shear in conventional type of wind turbines. The objective of this paper is to introduce the assessment parameters of the wind energy production of sites and pairing between the sites and wind turbines.

PT J
AU Rajanna, S
   Saini, RP
AF Rajanna, S.

GP IEEE
TI Optimal Modeling of an Integrated Renewable Energy System with Battery
   Storage for off Grid Electrification of Remote Rural Area
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE lRES; Genetic Algorithm; Economic Model; Optimization Power Factor;
   Rural Electrification
ID PARTICLE SWARM OPTIMIZATION; DESIGN; INDIA; IRAN
AB The present study focuses an optimal modeling of an integrated renewable energy system by considering locally available different renewable energy sources namely micro hydro, solar, wind, biomass and biogas. Three decision variables, namely total active area of the PV panels, total swept area of wind turbine blades and state of charge (SOC) of battery system have been considered for optimization of proposed system. Seasonal hourly load demand have been synthesized through HOMER software based on estimated value of seasonal hourly load data. Genetic algorithm (GA) based approach has been used to minimize the total net present cost ( TNPC) with ensuring system reliability. Simulation results in terms of optimal size, TNPC and cost of energy have been obtained based on two scenarios namely, device types and resources combination. Based on simulation results, three optimal models are considered for the study area, out of these, model S2 (MHGBMG- BGG-WTG-BS) was found to be most feasible for the proposed remote area in Chamarajanagar district in Karnataka state, India. Further, optimal device types and resource combination for the proposed area have also been determined.
C1 [Rajanna, S.; Saini, R. P.] Indian Inst Technol, Alternate Hydro Energy Ctr, Roorkee 247667, Uttarakhand, India.

GP IEEE
TI Comparative Analysis of MPPT Algorithms using Wind Turbines with
   Different Dimensions & Ratings
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE FIRST IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON POWER
   ELECTRONICS, INTELLIGENT CONTROL AND ENERGY SYSTEMS (ICPEICES 2016)
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT 1st IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Intelligent
   Control and Energy Systems (ICPEICES)
CY JUL 04-06, 2016
CL Delhi Technol Univ, Delhi, INDIA
SP Delhi Technol Univ, Dept Elect Engn, IEEE PELS, IEEE IES, IEEE PES Delhi Chapter, IEEE IAS Delhi Chapter, IEEE Delhi Sect
HO Delhi Technol Univ
DE Maximum Power Point Tracking; Wind Turbine Characteristics; Tip Speed
   Ratio; Hili Climbing Search; Fuzzy Logic Control
ID TRACKING; SYSTEM
AB Wind energy is considered as a most reliable and developed renewable energy source. With the rapid growth in this area, new techniques and control are seen to achieve maximum utilization of wind power and operating the wind turbine (WT) at its optimal condition. Various maximum power point tracking ( MPPT) algorithms are available; however, a choice has to be made for the appropriate one as each algorithm has its own merits and demerits. This paper presents the comparison of three MPPT control algorithms: Tip speed ratio (TSR), Hili climb search (HCS) and Fuzzy based MPPT algorithm on three different size turbines of different power rating, in terms of their ability to extract maximum power output, number of iterations required i.e. speed responses and complexity using MATLAB. The results obtained in this paper may help the researchers to refer a suitable algorithm for their requirement.
