GP IEEE
TI Economic dispatch for microgrid with electric vehicles in plug-in
   charging and battery swapping modes
SO 2016 IEEE PES ASIA-PACIFIC POWER AND ENERGY ENGINEERING CONFERENCE
   (APPEEC)
SE Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
CY OCT 25-28, 2016
CL Xian, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP IEEE Power & Energy Soc, Xian Jiaotong Univ, Shaanxi Assoc Sci & Technol, China Soc Elect Engn, State Grid Key Lab Elect Power Environm Protect, Beijing Sifang Automat Co Ltd, State Grid Shaanxi Elect Power Co
DE microgrid; electric vehicles(EV); battery swapping mode; plug-in
   charging mode; economic dispatch
ID STATION
AB Due to the serious problems of energy shortage and environmental pollution, the microgrid and electric vehicles(EV) are getting more and more attention. The energy supply mode of EVs can be divided into two types, which are plug-in charging mode and battery swapping mode. The plug-in charging mode is divided into two types in terms of coordination. In this paper the dispatching models of microgrid with EVs in different energy supply modes are established. Each mode is analyzed and evaluated in this paper, and the advantages and disadvantages of the two modes are compared. A grid-connected microgrid consisting of a wind turbine (WT), photovoltaic cells (PV), a battery energy storage system (BESS), a micro turbine (MT), a diesel engine (DE), a fuel cell (FC) and several EVs is studied as an example. The results demonstrate the effectiveness of the dispatching model. Compared with the EV plug-in charging mode, the simulation results indicate that the microgrid with EVs in battery swapping mode is more economic.
C1 [Liu, Chunyang; Wang, Xiuli; Wu, Xiong; Zou, Yuntao; Zhang, Haitao; Yao, Li; Zhang, Yue] Xi An Jiao Tong Univ, Shaanxi Key Lab Smart Grid, Xian, Peoples R China.

TI Fault Ride Through Characteristics of Connection of Large Wind Power
   Island to VSC-HVDC Grid
SO 2016 IEEE PES ASIA-PACIFIC POWER AND ENERGY ENGINEERING CONFERENCE
   (APPEEC)
SE Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
CY OCT 25-28, 2016
CL Xian, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP IEEE Power & Energy Soc, Xian Jiaotong Univ, Shaanxi Assoc Sci & Technol, China Soc Elect Engn, State Grid Key Lab Elect Power Environm Protect, Beijing Sifang Automat Co Ltd, State Grid Shaanxi Elect Power Co
DE Connection of wind power island to grid; VSC-HVDC grid; Characteristics
   analysis; Fault ride-through
AB With increasing scale of wind power development, large wind power bases will, where there is no support from synchronous power source, be directly connected to the grid and therefore one of developing trends to transmit currently large-scale wind power is transmit the wind power "island" with the long distance VSC-HVDC transmission technology when it is connected to the grids. When a large-scale wind power island is connected to a VSC-HVDC grid, the wind turbines and the VSC-HVDC grid will influence each other's operation and control, and in particular, in the case of fault, mutual coupling of dynamic characteristics of electrical variables at different time scales between the wind turbines and the VSC-HVDC grid cannot be ignored. The paper is focused on non-synchronous detection of disturbance, one of key problems found in connection of wind power to the VSC-HVDC grid, and studies the fault ride-through (FRT) technology for the island-connected large-scale wind power and the VSC-HVDC grid, by analyzing the impact of fault-response characteristics of the wind power and the VSC-HVDC grid at different time scales on each other.
C1 [Li Yan; Liu Chao; Chi Yongning; Tang Haiyan] China Elect Power Res Inst, State Key Lab Operat & Control Renewable Energy &, Beijing, Peoples R China.
RP Li, Y (reprint author), China Elect Power Res Inst, State Key Lab Operat & Control Renewable Energy &, Beijing, Peoples R China.

TI A Simplified Equivalent Method of Wind Farm for Reliability Evaluation
SO 2016 IEEE PES ASIA-PACIFIC POWER AND ENERGY ENGINEERING CONFERENCE
   (APPEEC)
SE Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
CY OCT 25-28, 2016
CL Xian, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP IEEE Power & Energy Soc, Xian Jiaotong Univ, Shaanxi Assoc Sci & Technol, China Soc Elect Engn, State Grid Key Lab Elect Power Environm Protect, Beijing Sifang Automat Co Ltd, State Grid Shaanxi Elect Power Co
DE equivalent method; MTTS; reliability assessment; wind power
AB The power system that only consists of traditional generators is easy to assess the reliability using Monte Carlo simulation because the generator can be seen as a two-state model. But the wind turbine generator cannot be treated as a two-state model in a power system with large scale wind power for the randomness and intermittent of wind. However, a simplified equivalent method of wind farm for reliability evaluation is proposed in this paper and used to turn a large scale wind farm that consists of different types and numbers of WTG to just one equivalent generator in the sense of reliability evaluation. The basic parameters in traditional algorithm such as the mean time to failure (MTTF) and the mean time to repair (MTTR) are replaced by the mean time to shake (MTTS) and the equivalent mean time to repair (EMTTR). The validity of the method is proved by the improved RTS79 system. The reliability index like EENS and LOLE are calculated using this equivalent method and its outcome are compared to that using traditional Monte Carlo simulation. This paper provide a new thought to simplify the model of wind turbines group and has some guiding effects on the power system reliability assessment considering large-scale wind power integration.
C1 [Zhang, Zece; Wang, Xiuli; Wu, Zechen; Shen, Tianshi] Xi An Jiao Tong Univ, Sch Elect Engn, Xian, Peoples R China.
RP Zhang, ZC (reprint author), Xi An Jiao Tong Univ, Sch Elect Engn, Xian, Peoples R China.

TI An Analytic Method of Calculating Rotor and Stator Short-Circuit Current
   of DFIG with RSC Control
SO 2016 IEEE PES ASIA-PACIFIC POWER AND ENERGY ENGINEERING CONFERENCE
   (APPEEC)
SE Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
CY OCT 25-28, 2016
CL Xian, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP IEEE Power & Energy Soc, Xian Jiaotong Univ, Shaanxi Assoc Sci & Technol, China Soc Elect Engn, State Grid Key Lab Elect Power Environm Protect, Beijing Sifang Automat Co Ltd, State Grid Shaanxi Elect Power Co
DE analytic calculation; doubly-fed induction generator (DFIG); rotor side
   converter (RSC); short-circuit current
ID FED INDUCTION GENERATOR; WIND TURBINES
AB To investigate the fault features of doubly-fed induction generator (DFlG) with rotor side converter (RSC) control, an analytic method of calculating the DFIG short-circuit current is proposed in this paper. Based on the space vector model of DFIG with RSC control, the dynamic equation of rotor current reflecting both the machine transient process and the impact of RSC control is derived, and analytic expressions of rotor and stator fault current in time-domain are obtained. The calculation result is certified by being compared with the PSCAD simulation result. A ccording to the derived analytic expressions, the components of the DFIG short-circuit current are analyzed. It indicates that the machine terminal voltage dip of DFIG, the current reference value, the orientation angle, and the proportional-integral value of RSC controller are main factors influencing the short-circuit current characteristics.

GP IEEE
TI Model Predietive Based Automatie Generation Control with Partieipation
   of the Output-constrained Wind Farms
SO 2016 IEEE PES ASIA-PACIFIC POWER AND ENERGY ENGINEERING CONFERENCE
   (APPEEC)
SE Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
CY OCT 25-28, 2016
CL Xian, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP IEEE Power & Energy Soc, Xian Jiaotong Univ, Shaanxi Assoc Sci & Technol, China Soc Elect Engn, State Grid Key Lab Elect Power Environm Protect, Beijing Sifang Automat Co Ltd, State Grid Shaanxi Elect Power Co
DE automatie generation control; wind farms; model predictive control; wind
   power curtailment
ID TURBINE-GENERATOR
AB With the rapid growth of installed wind power generation, there has been an increased interest for wind farms to participate in automatie generation control (AGC). While participating in AGC under normal conditions, wind farms have to track set-points by deloading control, instead of operating in maximum power point tracking (MPPT). However, if wind farms participate in AGC when their allowed outputs are lower than their capabilities due to security constraints, they could contribute to frequency regulation and reduce their wind energy curtailment simultaneously. This paper first iIIustrates the pitch angle control for wind turbines to track set-points. Then, a new controller based on model predictive control (MPC) is proposed, considering wind farms participating in AGC when their outputs are constrained. Simulation results show that the contributions of wind farms to AGC can help to suppress frequency fluctuation notably. The comparison with a proportional integral (PI) controller shows the effectiveness of proposed controller.

GP IEEE
TI A Method of Synthesizing Coordinated Optimization between FACTS and HVDC
   for Curbing Large-scale Wind Turbine Tripping
SO 2016 IEEE PES ASIA-PACIFIC POWER AND ENERGY ENGINEERING CONFERENCE
   (APPEEC)
SE Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
CY OCT 25-28, 2016
CL Xian, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP IEEE Power & Energy Soc, Xian Jiaotong Univ, Shaanxi Assoc Sci & Technol, China Soc Elect Engn, State Grid Key Lab Elect Power Environm Protect, Beijing Sifang Automat Co Ltd, State Grid Shaanxi Elect Power Co
DE Flexible AC transmission system (FACTS); controllable shunt
   reactor(CSR); high-voltage direct current (HVDC); wind turbine tripping;
   control costs; coordination optimization
AB Along with the rapid development of AC-DC hybrid power system, Flexible AC transmission system (FACTS) and HVDC transmission system has been widely used in electric power system, which provides a new control technology and effective means for curbing large-scale wind turbine tripping in china in recent years. The wind turbine tripping scene after the AC/DC faults is analyzed, which shows that suppressing large voltage fluctuation after fault is the key of reducing wind turbine tripping, and then the necessity of coordination between the optimal configuration of FACTS equipment before fault and HVDC emergency power support after fault for curbing wind turbine tripping is expounded. On the premise that power system is security and stability, It explores ways of solving the problem of large-scale wind turbine tripping through coordinated optimization between FACTS and HVDC with minimum cost control. Under the sensitivity index of improving the wind farm collection bus bar voltage fluctuation, it realizes curbing large-scale wind turbine tripping and economic operation of power grid through coordination optimization with pre-accident stationing and capacity configuration of FACTS equipment and post-accident HVDC emergency power support. At last, it is validated by a schedule power grid.
C1 [Chang Haijun; Hou Yuqiang; Li Wei; Zhongqing, Sun; Yanjun, Wang; Yazhou, Lv] Nanjing NARI Grp Co Ltd, Nanjing 210003, Jiangsu, Peoples R China.

GP IEEE
TI Coordinative Control Strategy of Virtual Inertia and Primary Frequency
   of DFIGs Based Wind Farms
SO 2016 IEEE PES ASIA-PACIFIC POWER AND ENERGY ENGINEERING CONFERENCE
   (APPEEC)
SE Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
CY OCT 25-28, 2016
CL Xian, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP IEEE Power & Energy Soc, Xian Jiaotong Univ, Shaanxi Assoc Sci & Technol, China Soc Elect Engn, State Grid Key Lab Elect Power Environm Protect, Beijing Sifang Automat Co Ltd, State Grid Shaanxi Elect Power Co
DE DFIGs; wind farms; virtual inertia; primary frequency; coordinative
   control strategy
ID TURBINES
AB The mechanical parts of doubly fed induction generators (DFIGs) is decoupled from electrical parts, which makes the output active power hard to respond the frequency change of power grid, it becomes a new challenge to frequency stability of power grid with large scale wind power grid integration. A coordinative control strategy of virtual inertia and primary frequency of DFIGs based wind farms is given, and its principle is analyzed in the paper. The primary frequency control is a slow process, which is mainly implemented by control level of DFIGs based wind farms, and the DFIGs is cooperative. The virtual inertia control is a fast process, which is only implemented by control level of DFIGs. The theoretical analysis and time domain simulation show that the proposed control strategy can guarantee the frequency stability of power grid with large scale wind power integration.
C1 [Tian, Xinshou; Wang, Weisheng; Li, Yan; Tang, Haiyan; Chi, Yongning; Wang, Yukun; Wang, Zhen] China Elect Power Res Inst, State Key Lab Operat & Control Renewable Energy &, Beijing 100192, Peoples R China.
RP Tian, XS (reprint author), China Elect Power Res Inst, State Key Lab Operat & Control Renewable Energy &, Beijing 100192, Peoples R China.

TI Review on Over-frequency Generator Tripping for Frequency Stability
   Control
SO 2016 IEEE PES ASIA-PACIFIC POWER AND ENERGY ENGINEERING CONFERENCE
   (APPEEC)
SE Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
CY OCT 25-28, 2016
CL Xian, PEOPLES R CHINA
SP IEEE Power & Energy Soc, Xian Jiaotong Univ, Shaanxi Assoc Sci & Technol, China Soc Elect Engn, State Grid Key Lab Elect Power Environm Protect, Beijing Sifang Automat Co Ltd, State Grid Shaanxi Elect Power Co
DE Over-frequency Generator Tripping; Frequency Control; Over-speed
   Protection Control (OPC)
AB Over-frequency generator tripping is an important measure in the third defense line of power system to avoid overfrequency problems. Over the last several decades, with the appearance of large interconnected system, the risk of overfrequency accident has increased, drawing much more attention to over-frequency problem. This paper reviews relevant literature on over-frequency generator tripping and summarizes the current research situation. According to the common overfrequency accidents, the paper introduces relatively reasonable configuration principles and setting strategies which are derived in the early period of the over-frequency generator tripping research. Then, the over-frequency generator tripping research entered into comparatively advanced periods mainly featuring with two characteristics. One is the cooperation of overfrequency generator tripping and over-speed protection control (OPC). And the other is to take the emergency frequency control of wind-turbine generator units into consideration. At last, abrief introduction of the latest creative research about over-frequency generator tripping strategies and setting methods are given. The paper comprehensively summarizes the development status of over-frequency generator tripping, providing valuable experience for frequency stability control.
C1 [Song, Zhiming] State Grid China Technol Coll, Jinan, Peoples R China.
   [Lin, Yong] State Grid Weifang Elect Power Co, Weifang, Peoples R China.
